text: Aroma; nut, chocolate, coffee, dark malts. Look; beige head, near black body. Taste; roasted malts, nut, chocolate, prune, plum - dry chocolate finish. Feel; good, soft co2. Overall; easy gentle tmavy. Shared bottle at local tasting. ABV is 5.4%. Very dark brown colour, huge beige head. Aroma of caramel and bakery. Malty flavour, caramel but not overly sweet, brown bread. Some dry bittering hops in the finish.

Share bottle at RB/HD at Gunnar´s 29.11.16. 5.4 % ABV. Dark brown. Huge brown head. Aroma of dark caramel, medium dark malt and slightly sour dark berries. Also a hint of liquorice. Similar taste. Quite dry. Good quaffability.
Shared bottle at local tasting. ABV 5,4%. Pours very dark ruby with a big creamy beige head. Aroma of dark caramel and toffee, inviting. Taste is well balanced, light roasty finish. Very good one.

0,75 flaske (5,4%, ikke 5,5) delt på RBHD-treff hos Odd Gunnar nov-16: brunsvart med mørkt rødlig skjær. Tet og højt skum der varer. Aroma og smak av mørke karameller, knekk, ristet brød, kaffe og litt sjokolade i en deilig kombinasjon. Tørr og fin bitterhet i ettersmaken gjør at den glir sorgløst over drøvelen.

Keg @ 20 PIP. Very dark, long lasting, creamy, khaki head, leaving rich lacing. Sweet chocolate aroma, coffee with cream and some mild rosted notes. Light and smooth mouthfeel, mild carbonated. Chocolate and caramel taste, nuts, grass and toast. Mid-dry finish.

Tap at 20 pip. Dark brown to ruby colour. Aroma coffee, dryish malty roasty. Taste is rich and malty, equal balance of caramelly chocolatey sweetness and dry coffeeish roast. Full body yet easy drinking.
Tap at 20 pip, Prague. Dark brown color with thick creamy light beige head. Caramel malt, dark malt, light red fruits. Taste, dark malt, roasted malt in taste. Good.

Very dark brown body with some reddish kind on the light, foam is quite brownish, but very stable. Some caramel and strong coffee aroma makes the overall perception a bit weaker. The body is medium - not so thin as a casual dunkel, but not as thick as a porter/stout, a bit too sweat and coffeed for my humble taste, but the pluses - refreshable and drinkable simple beer. Not art, but not so bad.

(Draught at Kulovy Blesk, Prague, 17 July 2014) Black colour with creamy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with caramel, coffee, dark rye bread, liquorice and a touch of tobacco. Malty, roasted taste with notes of caramel, chocolate, coffee, black rye bread, liquorice and a gentle roasty bitterness in a finish with a slight sweetness. Medium body, with balanced sweetness. Fresh, tasty and well made dark lager in excellent balance. Very nice.

Lahev(PET, 1,0l): Really deep amber coloured with ruby spots, small, but persistent off-white head; moderate sweet malty and roasty nose; moderate sweet flavour, some well hidden bitterness, medium nodied and soft; increasing dryness in the sweet dark-malty and nutty finish. Quite nice, one of the first brews of this brand-new brewery, but still too much on the sweet side
